data.title: International reactions to the COVID-19 pandemic in Italy
data.text:
Asia

Armenia â Armenia confirmed that three cases were imported from Italy on 12 March.[123]

Azerbaijan â On 11 March a student tested positive after developing fever in Italy.[124]

Bangladesh â On 8 March, Bangladesh confirmed its first cases; two are Bangladeshis who had returned from Italy and another is a family member of one of the two who returned.[125]

India â On 2 March, New Delhi confirmed its first case, an Indian national who had returned from Italy.[126] On the same day, an Italian tourist who had arrived in Jaipur, Rajasthan on 29 February tested positive in a second test after having previously tested negative.[127] On 3 March, his wife also tested positive.[128] On 4 March 14 more Italian tourists who were kept at a quarantine facility in Delhi were confirmed positive, as well as the group's Indian driver.[129] A Paytm employee in Gurgaon who had returned from a vacation in Italy also tested positive.[130] On 8 March, five members of a family in Kerala tested positive, three of whom had returned from Italy.[131]

Israel â On 27 February, Israel confirmed that a man who had returned from Italy on 23 February tested positive.[132][133][134] On 28 February, his wife also tested positive.[135]

Japan â On 13 March, Japan confirmed that a man who had been in Italy since 6 January tested positive for coronavirus upon landing at Haneda Airport in Tokyo that day.[136]

Jordan â On 2 March, Jordan confirmed that a man who had returned from Italy two weeks earlier had tested positive, with other potential cases under observation.[137][138]

Mainland China â On 1 March, Qingtian County, Lishui, Zhejiang confirmed its first imported case, a 31-year-old Chinese woman who had worked at a restaurant in Bergamo.[139] On 2 March, seven more imported cases were confirmed in Qingtian County that are related to the first imported case.[140] Beijing reported one imported case on 3 March, four on 5 March, three on 6 March, one on 7 March and five on March.[141][142][143][144][145] On 4 March, Deqing County, Huzhou, Zhejiang confirmed two new imported cases from Italy.[146] On 10 March, Shanghai confirmed two new imported cases from Italy. They are native in Fujian and work in Italy.[147] Qingdao, Shandong also confirmed the first imported case from Italy.[148] On 11 March, Zhengzhou, Henan confirmed the first imported case, who stay in Italy.[149] On 12 March, Shanghai confirmed one more imported case.[150] On 13 March, Shanghai confirmed four more imported cases.[151] On 14 March, Shanghai confirmed one more imported case,[152] and Beijing also confirmed one more imported case from Italy.[153] On 15 March, Beijing confirmed two more imported cases,[154] and Shanghai also confirmed one more.[155] On 16 March, Shanghai and Guangxi separately confirmed one more imported case from Italy.[156][157] On 20 March, Beijing confirmed one more imported case.[158]

Malaysia â On 28 February, Malaysia confirmed that an Italian who was married to a Malaysian tested positive and was admitted to Sungai Buloh Hospital. He was in Italy from 15 to 21 February for work.[159]

Maldives â The Maldives' first cases were two staffers at Kuredu Island Resort who caught the disease from an Italian tourist who had returned to Italy and tested positive there.[160]

Oman â A case was recorded of a patient who had travelled to Milan.[161]

Philippines â On 23 March, a 61-year-old woman with a travel history to Italy became Baguio's first confirmed case of COVID-19 (Case 110).[162]

Saudi Arabia â On 14 March, Saudi Arabia announced 17 new cases, including some citizens who had recently travelled to Italy.[163]

Singapore â On 7 March, eight new cases of infection were confirmed in Singapore, one of which was a 36 year old Italian man (Case 136).[164]

South Korea â On 28 February, South Korea confirmed that a 38-year-old man living in Gwangjin who visited Milan from 19 to 24 February was admitted to Seoul Medical Centre.[165][166]

Sri Lanka â A group of infected Italian tourists passed on the disease to a 52-year-old tour guide.[167]

Thailand â On 5 March, Thailand announced that its 44th and 45th confirmed cases, a 29-year-old Italian and 42-year-old Thai, had arrived in Thailand from Italy on 2 March. Both were admitted in Chonburi Province.[168]

United Arab Emirates â On 28 February, two Italian staff members of the UAE Tour, tested positive.[169]

Vietnam â Case 17 had travelled to Italy (as well as to France and the UK).[170]

Europe

Albania â On 9 March 2020, Albania confirmed its first two cases, a father and son, of which the son had traveled from Florence, Italy.[171] On 10 March, 6 out of the 10 new cases were close contacts of the first 2.[172]

Andorra â On 2 March, Andorra registered its first case, a man who had been to Milan.[173]

Austria â On 25 February, Austria confirmed its first two cases, a man and a woman who had visited their hometown in Bergamo, who tested positive and were treated at a hospital in Innsbruck, Tyrol.[174][175][176][177] On 27 February, a couple who tested positive and their two children who were showing symptoms were admitted to Kaiser-Franz-Josef Hospital. The family was previously on holiday in Lombardy.[178][179] On 28 February, one of the children, a 15-year-old boy, tested positive.[180]

Belgium â Nine patients diagnosed with the virus had travelled from Northern Italy.[181] Belgium has confirmed that there are many more and that Italy is the source of most of its cases.

Belarus â A case was confirmed as having been imported from Italy.[182][183]

Bosnia and Herzegovina â A man working in Italy transmitted the virus to his child.[184]

Croatia â On 25 February, Croatia confirmed its first case, a man who had until 21 February stayed in Milan.[185][186] On 26 February, the man's brother tested positive and a Croatian man who worked in Parma, Italy also tested positive and was admitted to a hospital in Rijeka.[186]

Cyprus â One of the country's first two cases had a travel history to Milan.[187]

Czechia â On 1 March, Czechia confirmed its first three cases.[188] As of 8 March 24, 31 confirmed cases in the country have links to Italy, leading the government to institute a mandatory quarantine for all persons with a history of recent travel to Italy.[189]

Denmark â On 27 February, Denmark confirmed its first case, a man who had returned from a ski holiday in Valmalenco, Sondrio, and quarantined at home.[190][191] On 28 February, a man who had returned from a ski holiday in Northern Italy on 15 February tested positive in Copenhagen and was placed in home quarantine.[192] On 29 February, an employee at the Aarhus University Hospital who had been to a conference in Munich, Germany, where he had met an infected person from Italy, tested positive.[193] On 3 March, five people who had returned from Northern Italy tested positive.[194][195]

Estonia â On 3 March, Estonia confirmed its second case, a patient who had arrived on 29 February from Bergamo and was travelling through Riga Airport.[196] Two other Estonian passengers from the same flight and one returnee from Bergamo arriving through Tallinn Airport tested positive on 5 March.[197][198] Two cases in Saaremaa were confirmed on 10 March: the patients had been in contact with the Power Volley Milano team members during the 2019â2020 CEV Challenge Cup matches held in Saaremaa on 4 and 5 March.[199][200] On 9 March 5 Milan players had been diagnosed with fever before a league match.[201] The infected in Saaremaa included the CEO of the Saaremaa VK volleyball club.[202] Saare County quickly became the worst hit part of the country.[203]

Finland â On 26 February, Finland confirmed that a Finnish woman who had visited Milan and was back in Finland on 22 February tested positive at the Helsinki University Central Hospital.[204] On 28 February, a Finnish woman who had travelled to Northern Italy tested positive at the Helsinki and Uusimaa Hospital District and was placed in home isolation.[205]

France â On 25 February, France confirmed that a man from La Balme-de-Sillingy who had returned from a trip to Lombardy on 15 February tested positive and was treated at Centre Hospitalier Annecy-Genevois, Ãpagny-Metz-Tessy.[23][206][207] His wife also tested positive and was admitted to the same hospital.[208][209] On 26 February 2020, a 36-year-old man who had made multiple trips to Lombardy tested positive and was treated at Nouvel HÃ´pital Civil, Strasbourg.[210][211][212] On 27 February 2020, a daughter and a friend of the infected couple from La Balme-de-Sillingy were confirmed positive.[213] An Italian man living in Montpellier who had just returned from Italy was admitted to Centre Hospitalier Universitaire.[214] A person who had travelled to Italy was admitted to HÃ´pital Bichat, Paris.[215] On 28 February 2020, two relatives of the infected couple from La Balme-de-Sillingy tested positive.[216] A 23-year-old fashion student from Nice who had recently returned from Milan tested positive at Nice University Hospital Centre and was admitted to HÃ´pital l'Archet.[217][218][219]

Germany â On 25 February 2020, Germany confirmed that a 25-year-old man from GÃ¶ppingen, Baden-WÃ¼rttemberg who recently returned from Milan tested positive and was treated in Klinik am Eichert.[220][221] On 26 February 2020, the man's 24-year-old girlfriend and her 60-year-old father, a chief physician at University Hospital TÃ¼bingen, tested positive and were admitted to the same hospital.[222][223] A 32-year-old man from Rottweil, Baden-WÃ¼rttemberg who had visited Codogno with his family on 23 February tested positive and was admitted to a hospital for isolation.[224] On 27 February, Bavaria confirmed that a man from Middle Franconia tested positive after having contact with an Italian man who later tested positive.[225] Baden-WÃ¼rttemberg confirmed that two women and a man from Breisgau-Hochschwarzwald and Freiburg, respectively, tested positive. They had contact with an Italian participant at a business meeting in Munich who tested positive in Italy. A man from BÃ¶blingen who had had contact with the girlfriend of the patient from GÃ¶ppingen also tested positive.[226] On 28 February, a man from Freiburg who had travelled to Bergamo tested positive and underwent isolation.[227] A man from Rhine-Neckar was admitted to the University Hospital Heidelberg.[228] A 32-year-old man in Heilbronn who was in Milan on 21 February fell ill and was admitted to a hospital.[229] As of 27 March 2020 Germany recorded 1443 cases directly linked to Italy[230]

Georgia â On 28 February 2020, Georgia confirmed that a 31-year-old Georgian woman who had travelled to Italy tested positive and was admitted to Infectious Diseases Hospital in Tbilisi.[231]

Greece â On 26 February 2020, Greece confirmed its first case, a 38-year-old woman from Thessaloniki who had recently visited Northern Italy and was admitted to AHEPA University Hospital.[232][233][234] On 27 February, her 9-year-old child tested positive and was admitted to the same hospital.[235] A 40-year-old woman from Athens who had travelled to Italy tested positive.[236][237][238][239] On 28 February, a 36-year-old woman from Athens who had recently travelled to Italy tested positive. Both were admitted to the Attikon University General Hospital.[240]

Hungary â Three of the seven cases in Hungary reported to date are linked to Italy.[241][242]

Iceland â On 28 February 2020, Iceland confirmed its first case, an Icelandic male in his 50s who had previously been to Northern Italy and was placed in strict isolation in LandspÃ­tali in ReykjavÃ­k.[243][244][245] On 5 March, a total of 34 cases had been confirmed in Iceland, most of which are imported cases from Italy.[246][247]

Ireland â On 27 February 2020, Ireland's first case was confirmed by the Health Protection Surveillance Centre. The male patient had travelled to an affected region in Northern Italy.[248] A second, unrelated case was confirmed on 3 March, a female in the eastern portion of Ireland who had travelled to Italy.[249]

Latvia â On 2 March, Latvia confirmed its first case, a person who had travelled from Milan to Munich and then to Riga on 29 February.[250]

Lithuania â On 28 February, Lithuania confirmed its first case, a 39-year-old woman who arrived in Kaunas from Verona.[251]

Luxembourg â The nation's second and fourth cases were persons who had travelled to Italy.[252][253]

Malta â A 12-year-old Italian brought the infection to Malta.[254]

Moldova â On 7 March, Moldova confirmed its first case, a 48-year-old woman who had returned from Italy.[255] Moldova confirmed the existence of imported case from diseased Italy on 11 March.[256]

Netherlands â On 27 February, the Netherlands confirmed its first case, a man who had been in Lombardy and was admitted to Elisabeth-TweeSteden Hospital in Tilburg.[257][258] On 28 February, a woman from Amsterdam who had visited Lombardy was in home isolation in Diemen.[259]

North Macedonia â On 26 February, North Macedonia confirmed its first case, a woman who tested positive at the Clinic for Infectious Diseases, Skopje. She had stayed in Italy for a month and had been sick for two weeks. Upon returning to North Macedonia, she immediately reported to the clinic.[260][261]

Norway â On 27 February, Norway confirmed that two people who tested positive were linked to the outbreak in Italy. They were quarantined at home in Oslo.[262] On 28 February, an individual from Bergen and an employee of Oslo University Hospital, UllevÃ¥l tested positive and were placed in home isolation. Both had visited Northern Italy.[263][264] On 6 March, the Norwegian Institute of Public Health reported that 79 of the 113 confirmed cases in Norway were linked to the outbreak in northern Italy.[265]

Poland â Of the country's first five cases, two were from Italy, two were from Germany and one was from the UK.[266]

Portugal â On 2 March, a doctor who had travelled to Northern Italy and became ill on 29 February was confirmed positive at Hospital de SÃ£o JoÃ£o in Porto. On 4 March, a 44-year-old man who had travelled to Italy was confirmed positive at the same hospital.[267][268]

Romania â On 26 February, Romania confirmed its first case, a man from Gorj who tested positive after having come in contact with a 71-year-old man from Cattolica, Italy. The Italian man visited his wife's family and had several business meetings in Romania from 18 to 22 February. The Romanian man was admitted to National Institute of Infectious Diseases Prof. Dr. Matei BalÈ in Bucharest.[269][270] On 28 February, a 45-year-old man from MaramureÈ who had returned from Italy on 25 February was admitted to the Clinic of Infectious Diseases and then transferred to Cluj.[271] A 38-year-old woman who had returned from Bergamo tested positive was admitted to a hospital in TimiÈoara.[271] On 3 March, a 47-year-old man who had travelled in the same plane with the 38-year-old woman was confirmed positive and admitted to the same hospital.[272] The majority of confirmed cases in Romania are related to Italy.[273]

Russia â On 2 March, a Russian citizen who had returned from Italy was diagnosed.[274]

San Marino â On 27 February, San Marino confirmed its first case, an 88-year-old man with pre-existing medical conditions who was hospitalised at Rimini Hospital.[275][276]

Serbia â On 6 March, Serbia registered its first case, a 43-year-old man who had been to Budapest and Italy. At least one other case had been to Italy.[277]

Slovakia â An asymptomatic man who had travelled to Venice between 14 and 15 February transmitted the virus to his father and his wife.[278]

Slovenia â Many Slovenian cases are linked to Italy, including the nation's first case.[279]

Spain â On 24 February, a 69-year-old medical doctor from Lombardy who had been vacationing in Tenerife since 17 February tested positive at the University Hospital of the Nuestra SeÃ±ora de Candelaria. A 25-year-old man returning from a holiday in Italy also tested positive in Asturias.[280][281][282][283] On 25 February, the wife of the doctor from Lombardy tested positive and was admitted to the same hospital where her husband was being treated.[284] A 36-year-old Italian woman living in Barcelona who had visited Bergamo and Milan from 12 to 22 February also tested positive.[23][281][285] A man from Villarreal who had recently travelled to Milan tested positive and was admitted to Hospital Universitario de La Plana.[286] A 24-year-old man from Madrid who had recently returned from Northern Italy tested positive and was admitted to Hospital Carlos III.[287][288] On 26 February, two Italian tourists who were vacationing with the Lombardy doctor and his wife also tested positive. The group were transferred to University Hospital of the Nuestra SeÃ±ora de Candelaria and underwent quarantine.[289] A 22-year-old man from Barcelona who travelled to Milan between 22 and 25 February tested positive and was admitted to Hospital ClÃ­nic.[290][291] A woman from La Gomera who travelled to Italy between 4 and 8 February tested positive and was admitted to Hospital General de La Gomera in Tenerife.[292] On 27 February, a 44-year-old man from Valencia who worked as a sportswriter and had travelled to Milan's San Siro Stadium on 19 February to watch a football game tested positive and was admitted to Hospital ClÃ­nico Universitario de ValÃ¨ncia. Two other people with whom he had made contact also tested positive and were admitted to the same hospital. Two more people who had visited the same football game in Milan were hospitalised at the same place.[293][294][295][296] A woman who had visited Milan was hospitalised at Hospital de Sagunto, Valencia.[296] An Italian student studying in Valencia who had visited Northern Italy was admitted to Hospital Universitario Doctor Peset.[296] A 22-year-old woman from Tenerife who had travelled to Italy from 19 to 25 February was admitted to Hospital ClÃ­nic.[297] An 18-year-old Italian student studying at IE University, Segovia, who had just returned from Milan, was admitted to Hospital General de Segovia.[298][299] On 28 February, a 27-year-old man from Aragon with a history of recent trips to Milan tested positive.[300]

Sweden â On 26 February, Sweden confirmed that a 30-year-old man who previously visited Northern Italy fell ill three days after returning to Sweden and was admitted to Sahlgrenska University Hospital in Gothenburg.[301][302][303] On 27 February, three patients in their 30s were confirmed positive in VÃ¤stra GÃ¶taland. Two of them had been in contact with the Gothenburg patient, while the other had previously visited Italy.[304][305][306] On 28 February, a man in his 50s who had returned from Northern Italy on 24 February tested positive and was admitted to a hospital in JÃ¶nkÃ¶ping.[307]

Switzerland â On 25 February, Switzerland confirmed its first case, a 70-year-old man in the canton of Ticino who had previously visited Milan.[281][308] On 27 February, a 28-year-old IT worker from Geneva who had recently returned from Milan tested positive and was admitted to Geneva University Hospital.[309][310] Two Italian children on vacation in GraubÃ¼nden tested positive and were hospitalised.[311][310][312] A 26-year-old man in Aargau who had visited Verona on a business trip the previous week tested positive and was hospitalised.[310] A 30-year-old woman who visited Milan was admitted to a hospital in Zurich.[310] A young woman who had travelled to Milan tested positive in Basel-City. She worked for a daycare centre in Riehen, and after her test was confirmed, the children at the daycare were put into a two-week quarantine.[313] On 28 February, her partner, a 23-year-old man, also tested positive in Basel-Country.[314] On 29 February, the man's mother tested positive as well. On 28 February, a 45-year-old-man who had travelled to Milan tested positive in ZÃ¼rich.[314]

Ukraine â On 3 March, Ukraine confirmed its first case in Chernivtsi, a man who had travelled from Italy by plane to the Romanian city of Suceava and then to Ukraine by car with his wife.[315]

United Kingdom â On 27 February, the United Kingdom confirmed that a patient who had visited Milan tested positive and was admitted to Royal Free Hospital in London.[316] Northern Ireland reported its first case, an adult who had travelled from Northern Italy via Dublin and was admitted to Royal Victoria Hospital in Belfast.[317] On 28 February, Wales reported its first case, a patient who had returned from northern Italy was treated at a specialist unit in England.[318]
